job_description:
Job Title: Software Developer Engineer in Test (SDET) - Gaming Industry

Company Overview:
We are a leading video game development studio dedicated to revolutionizing the mobile sports gaming experience. Our team is passionate about exploring new horizons and harnessing blockchain technology to create unforgettable gaming adventures for players worldwide. As a global company, we have assembled a team of talented professionals from the Americas and Europe who are committed to pushing the boundaries of mobile gaming.

Role Overview:
We are looking for a skilled Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to drive the development of our groundbreaking mobile game. As an SDET, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our games. Collaborating closely with our development and quality assurance teams, you will design, implement, and maintain automated testing solutions to deliver high-quality gaming experiences. If you are enthusiastic about game development, player-focused, and tech-savvy, we invite you to join our team!

Responsibilities:
Test Automation: Develop and maintain automated test scripts and frameworks for various game components, including gameplay mechanics, user interfaces, and backend systems.
Test Automation Planning: Work closely with technical directors, game designers, developers, and QA teams to create comprehensive automation test plans covering all aspects of game functionality and performance.
Continuous Integration: Integrate automated tests into the continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline to enable frequent and efficient testing of game builds.
Bug Tracking: Identify and report software defects, monitor their resolution progress, and ensure proper documentation and prioritization.
Performance Testing: Conduct performance and load testing to ensure our games can handle expected player loads and provide a seamless gaming experience.
Regression Testing: Implement, maintain, and execute regression test suites to detect and prevent regression issues as the game evolves.
Cross-Platform Testing: Verify game compatibility across multiple platforms and devices, including PC, consoles, and mobile, using automation.
Quality Advocacy: Promote quality within the development team by advocating for best practices, providing testing expertise, and championing the player's experience.
Test Reporting: Create and maintain clear and concise test documentation, reports, and metrics to track testing progress and communicate results to stakeholders.
Autonomous Execution: Thrive in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating autonomy and initiative in your work.

Required Qualifications:
Proven experience as a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) in the game development industry.
Strong proficiency in programming languages commonly used in game development, such as C++, C#, Python.
Extensive knowledge of test automation tools and frameworks.
Familiarity with game engines and development environments, including Unity and Unreal Engine.
Solid understanding of software testing principles and methodologies.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Effective communication and teamwork abilities.
Passion for gaming and a genuine interest in player experiences.

Bonus Points for:
Master’s degree.
Experience with cloud-based testing services (e.g., AWS Device Farm, Firebase Test Lab).
Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git).
Experience with virtualization and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker).
Understanding of game-specific testing challenges, including multiplayer and online features.

What We Offer:
Fully remote work.
Flexible time off.
Contract-to-hire (this role is available as a contractor position as we establish entities outside of the UK).
